page.title: 01Landscape: Mid Cynon Valley.
page.content: The survey area is located in part of the Cynon valley.The valley was eroded by ice during the Ice Age and the typical trough-like feature of a glaciated valley is present here. The Cynon flows through this section in a north-west to south-east direction,to illustrate the typical superimposed drainage of the South-Wales Coalfield. The Cynon Valley is at its widest point in 0200, here the river meanders in a wide flood- plain with some marshland. The valley sides rise steeply from the valley floor to the mountain summits. The mountains themselves forming part of a dissected plateau. The Cynon has one major west bank tributary the Aman,which joins the Cynon at 020014
